availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jennings Hay (Clark Co., Indiana, physician and circuit court clerk)

body.p: Clark County, Indiana, physician and circuit court clerk. Indiana native. Son of Andrew Paxton Hay and Sarah Stites Fanny Bainbridge Gano Hay. Married to Rebecca C. Garrett Hay. Father of Frances E. Hay, Eugene G. Hay, and Mary Garrett Hay. Physician in Charlestown, Indiana, in 1850. Clerk of the Clark Circuit Court in Charlestown in 1860. Employed Elizabeth Dom as a servant in Charlestown in 1860. Clerk of the circuit court in Clark County in 1861. County clerk in Charlestown in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Charlestown, p. 91A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Charlestown, p. 146.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Clark County, IN, June 1863, p. 95.
Lineage Book of the National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, vol. 021 (1897) (Harrisburg, PA: 1906), 321.
